Sentencas: The influence of A-site cation doping, crystal structure and structural defects (oxygen nonstoichiometry) on the electrical conductivity of Sr-doped CaMnO3 (CSMO) and BaMnO3 (BSMO) was investigated.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites

Sentencas: CSMO and BSMO were prepared by citrate-nitrate autocombustion and coprecipitation synthesis, pressed into pellets and sintered.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites

Sentencas: Since the oxygen nonstoichiometry in CSMO was uniform, the increase in electrical conductivity was primarily caused by the increase in Sr content.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites

Sentencas: On the other hand, the oxygen nonstoichiometry in BSMO was more pronounced and it decreased with Sr-doping.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites

Sentencas: Therefore, the highest conductivities were obtained for the undoped BaMnO3 samples.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites

Sentencas: The electrical conductivities of CSMO were similar to those of widely investigated rare-earth manganites and more than 104 times higher than those of BSMO.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites

Sentencas: Therefore, CSMO has the potential to be a low-cost cathode material in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites
The role of the A-site cation and crystal structure on the electrical conductivity of strontium-doped calcium and barium manganites
